title: ecobrick
keywords: ecobrick, eco, eco-brique, ecobrique, ecoladrillo, Ecobrick, eco-brick, brik, ecobrik
description: An ecobrick is a plastic bottle densely packed with used plastic to create a reusable building block that achieves plastic sequestration.

title: ecobricking
keywords: ecobricking, ecobrick, ecobriking, briking, making, packing, eco, eco, ecobrique, ecoladrillo, Ecobrick, eco-brick, brik, ecobrik
description: The act of making an ecobrick: the process of separating, cleaning, drying, and compacting used plastic into a bottle in order to make an ecobrick.

title: biome
description: An ecosystem of ecosystems: a core component of a biosphere.

title: Ayyew
description: The Igorot virtue of ever increasing one’s sync with ecological cycles.

title: biosphere
description: The all-encompassing ecology of a planet (usually that of Earth).

title: biodiversity
description: The variety and plurality of species in a biological system.

title: cosmological character
description: The unique history, configuration, and composition of each planet that gives it its characteristic pattern of processes.

title: dap'ay
keywords: dapay, dap'ay, stone henge, mandala, stonehenge
description: The central stone plaza of every Igorot village that is used for ceremonies, feasts, and storytelling.

title: earth
description: Soil, ground [lowercase ‘e’]. Used with an article (i.e. “the”)

title: Earth
description: The third planet orbiting the sun [uppercase ‘E’]. Used without an article.

title: Earthen
description: Of the character of the Earth. [Capital ‘E’]

title: earthen
description: Of the earth (i.e. soil, ground) [lowercase ‘e’]

title: Earthen ethics
description: An ethical framework for discerning the ecological color of an act, process, or enterprise based on the example of Earth.

title: Earth Enterprise
description: An enterprise that strives first and foremost to enrich the biosphere by following Earth’s example.

title: Earthling
description: An inhabitant of planet Earth.

title: ecological contribution
description: A process that fully embodies the principles of Earthen ethics. A green ecological impact.

title: ecological consciousness
description: An awareness of one’s interconnection to the cycles of life near and far, old and new, local and global.

title: ecology
description: A biological system; a part of a biome.

title: green
description: An ecological contribution: a process that follows Earth’s example by embodying all the Earthen principles.

title: grey
description: A depleting ecological impact: a process that fails to embody all the Earthen principles.

title: fossil fuels
description: A modern term to describe the Earth’s ancient compacted carbon stores.

title: Igorots
keywords: Igorot, igorots, highlands, northern Luzon, West Philippines Sea
description: The people of the highlands of northern Luzon, in the West Philippines Sea.

title: humancentric
description: A view of the world in which humans are central and separate from the natural environment around them. Also, 'anthropocentric'.

title: cyclocentric
keywords: cyclocentric, cycle, kincentric, ecocentric, biocentric, synchony, William Henry Scott, Igorot Ayyew culture
description: From the Greek Κύκλος for 'Cycle', we introduce the term 'cyclocentric' to describe kincentric cultures and their propensity to self organize around the sync and celebration of Earthen cycles.

title: kincentric
description: In opposition to humancentric; a view of the world in which plants, humans, animals and all Earthen organisms share ancestry and origins, cycles and ecosystems.

title: petro-capital economy
keywords: petro-capital economy, petroleum energy, fossil fuels, flow of capital, capitalism,capital
description: An economy whose flow and generation of capital is powered by petroleum energy.

title: plastic sequestration
keywords: plastic sequestration, concentrating, compacting, building blocks, long-term storage, not-for-profit, consciousness, biodiversity, net-subtractive
description: The process of concentrating and compacting plastic to create short term building blocks that secure and store plastic over the long-term, in a not-for-profit process that raises consciousness, supports biodiversity and is net-subtractive.

title: plastic’s stellar story
description: The four billion year view of plastic as carbon sequestered by the Earth, and de-compacted by humans.

title: plastic 1.0
description: The paradigm of plastic as human made and managed.

title: plastic 2.0
keywords: plastic 2.0, Earth's process, cultivating biosphere, petro-capital economy
description: The paradigm of plastic as a part of the Earth’s billion year process of cultivating the biosphere and as representation of our petro-capital economy.

title: regenerative
keywords: regenerative, greening process, subtractive impact, additive impact
description: A greening process whose subtractive impact is over twice that of its additive impact.

title: Wetʼsuwetʼen
keywords: Wet'suwet'en, Wet'suwet'en Nation, First Nations, Bulkley River
description: Wetʼsuwetʼen are a First Nations people who live on the Bulkley River in the northwestern region of the Canadian province of British Columbia. The Wet'suwet'en Nation is composed of five clans, each of which has its own traditional territory and hereditary leaders.

title: Spiral Design
keywords: cycles, spiral, circular, cyclical, regenerative,design, principles
description: The Earthen principle of crafting indefinite cycles that ever enriching, both socially and ecologically.

title: for-Earth
keywords: Earth Enterprise, for-Earth, not-for-profit, for-profit, nfp, mcclurahan
description: The intention of an enterprise to strive first and foremost to enrich the biosphere by following Earth’s example.

title: mandala
description: Mandalas are an ancient and sacred, circular and geometric art that can be found in cultures around the world.  From the sanskrit, meaning 'circle'
